info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Montrose County through 515 PM MDT... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montrose, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Montrose around 440 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado between mile markers 121 and 130. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 88 and 98. Colorado 90 between mile markers 82 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
